alert.note: Alert for Brown; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 20 at 8:27PM CDT until June 21 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL ROCK...NORTHERN BROWN AND SOUTH CENTRAL KEYA PAHA COUNTIES... At 827 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Johnstown, or 10 miles west of Ainsworth, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ainsworth, Springview, Long Pine, Johnstown, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, Antelope Peak and Meadville. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 194 and 214. Highway 20 between mile markers 225 and 258. Highway 12 near mile marker 51. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
